117895361.review:
Did I ever tell you the definition of "Underrated"?


Well, that'd be THIS GAME. Literally, Far Cry Primal is THE definition of underrated.

It's a full-fledged Far Cry game, set in the stone age. It's still a FPS, Stealth open-world game in its core; with added features of Survival, Melee combat, Animal Taming and much more.

The most immersive, tense and unforgiving entry in the series since Far Cry 2. You're no longer an overpowered "hero" but a mere human fighting for survival in nature. Exotic beasts and apex predators are roaming around the world, you must use your wits and skills to make the most out of whatever the world throws at you.

Speaking of world, this is one of the most beautiful Jungle environments I've ever experienced in a game. I often found myself lost in awe of breathtaking vistas, from tall redwood forests in the west to the snowy canyons in the northern mountains, to an underwater cave here, to a grand waterfall over there. No matter where you go, the beauty of Oros will never fail to catch your attention.

If you enjoyed any of the previous Far Cry games, if you enjoy immersive digital adventures, heck, if you just like games in general, you'll love Far Cry Primal. Try it, you'll be pleasantly surprised, the Land of Oros awaits...

22460853.review:
I admit it: I'm a huge fan of Open World Collectathons.

While these types of games have now become pretty formulaic, some still try to do something new, and Far Cry: Primal is one of them.

No sniper rifles, C4, tanks or revolvers. Only your trusty stone axe, the double arrow bow, bee grenades and and an owl that drops LSD on your enemies.

This is 10,000 BC where you get to ride saber tigers, eat raw meat like there is no tomorrow, have acid trips where you shoot the moon with your bow and your hardest animal enemy is that damn badger once again.

Lots of different side quests that pop up all the time, some great cave platform puzzles, beautiful graphics and a stone age grappling hook makes this one of my favourite Ubisoft open world games of all time.

21750966.review:
Three things right off the bat because I see SO many negative reviews based on such silly stuff. 

1) If you're giving this game a negative review because you've played the other Far Cry games and you don't think it's up to par, I'd like to extend my deepest sympathies to you, that you tried something different and judged it on an already-existing standard. I'd like to point out that this wasn't supposed to be a direct copy of the other Far Cry games, whilst still being a Far Cry game. However out of all the reviews I see, these 'experts' are playing the game on normal and complaining about it being 'too easy'. I'm running around on expert mode having the time of my life and feeling some very REAL fear when confronted by a Sabretooth. A big part of Far Cry is immersion. Game is too easy? Up the difficulty. It's not neuroscience. If you're not feeling hunted when you're running around at night, you're not playing on a hard enough difficulty. Don't give a bad review because you didn't decide to challenge yourself. 

2) People keep complaining that the melee system is flawed. Why? Because there aren't brutal melee finishers for every weapon? Last time I checked if you got into a brawl with 3 guys with a club it's not going to be a moment of finesse. It's gonna be a moment of blind rage-induced swinging hoping to hit their faces. The same is true for the spear. If I stab someone in the face or the throat it counts as a 'headshot' and is an instant fatality. That is the sort of accuracy of a spear. You're trying to tell me we should be able to swing it around like a quarterstaff? Far Cry isn't known for prompted cinematic kill moves other than silent melee kills with most weapons. Why did you expect anything other than the very basic idea of an amateur swinging a stick? You're a caveman. Not a professional assassin. 

3) Complaining about the fact that they went through the trouble to include genuine proto-european dialect, or that the game is too short. I reiterate, a big part of Far Cry is immersion. If you're not paying attention to the script, the emotion in their voices, or the storyline, and then you complain about not enjoying it, it doesn't sound like a problem with the game. That sounds like a problem with you paying attention. When it comes to timeframe, I'm 33.3 hrs into the game right now, and due to difficulty level (died probably 14 times trying to kill Dah) and how I genuinely enjoy hunting in this game, I've got plenty of collectibles and side quests left, and several story and character missions. 

All in all, I'm not trying to bash anyone for their review because everyone has their own opinion. However I felt that this game was very harshly judged and mostly so because of the preceding games. People either expected something completely different or relatively the same. The weird balance in between seems to have some people upset, but did any of you really expect Far Cry to evolve as a series without some trail and error? Considering this is their first foray into any other era than modern, I'd say they did pretty damn good. 

8/10 For a decent story about the brutality of this time period.
9/10 For appearances, the game is just plain pretty on high settings! Spent probably over an hour of gameplay just admiring certain views!
9/10 for performance. From being attacked by Dholes at any moment to wondering if that growl from a Cave Lion was near or far, the game definitely gives the impression of a nonstop fight for survival.

36642306.review:
So happy to finally be able to say I've finished this game. I played on the hardest survival setting and It was a long 60 hours of enjoyment mixed with way too much, unnecessary frustration. This could have been an amazing game but it's still got that UBISOFT janky-ness that rears it's head every 30 mins or so. To keep it brief:

+ The graphics and sound are impressive. A very enjoyable world to experience.
+ The combat is great due to the new restrictions. Using a bow and arrow and perfecting your aim is really rewarding.
+ Great value - Plenty to do and a captivating world to get lost in.

- The AI is very good one minute then laughable the next. Buddy AI is just a joke. Enjoy getting trapped in an area due to your buddy blocking the entrance? Plenty of that!! Enemies can be impossible to it as they Michael Jackson all over the place. Good luck perfecting those long distance arrows!!
- Day night cycle is like someone switching a switch - One minute it's dark and then...boom, morning!!
- Navigating the terrain is just unbelievably tricky at times. It needed Dying Light's movement and nearly got there...just too many slopes to slip down when you should be able to climb.

If you love Far Cry due to nostalgia then this is more of the same with enough changes to make it feel worth while. Just expect the usual UBISOFT weirdness to show up now and again...well worth picking up in a sale! :)
